summary: In a way it almost feels like we’re still in the hiatus concerning Tyrus because we were launched into it with some of the...
body: In a way it almost feels like we’re still in the hiatus concerning Tyrus because we were launched into it with some of the strongest Tyrus content we’ve had & even though the episodes are back now, we still haven’t gotten much involving them & I know they’re only 1 part of the show & I know disney is very cautious with including scenes for them in general & don’t get me wrong, I love watching all the storylines involving all the different characters, but still… I miss them

blog.name: captainkippen
blog.title: you can be oblivious
blog.description: aaron • he/him • requests are open • fic masterlist • icon by simplycyrus

body:
Snow Day • Tyrus Oneshot

There’s something magical about snow. The way is drifts and dances throw the air, swirling flakes settling on branches and rooftops, covering the world in a blanket of glistening white brings a sense of peace unmatched by anything else.

Cyrus likes it best early in the morning when the sky is a little dark still and they haven’t expected such weather. Waking up to a fresh crisp snowfall, not yet disturbed by footprints or salt, it is just the most enchanting sight. He loves it with his entire soul.

This morning is no different to all the years before when snow has fallen… well, that’s a lie. It’s a little different. There is the usual childish glee that lights up inside of him when he sees it falling through the gap in his curtains. This is accompanied by the immediate desire to get up and take a look that he always experiences, however the one thing that’s different is that he can’t immediately get up.

He’s trapped.

Trapped by a warm arm slung carefully across his waist and the gentle snores into the pillow coming from behind him. The comfort of a chest pressed up against his back is almost enough to make him want to return to his snuggled up state under the blanket and wait for the alarm to go off and tell him to get up to make coffee, but the snow has woken him up better than any caffeine ever could.

“Hey,” he says softly, rolling over as carefully as possible so as not to disturb the arm wrapped around him too much. “TJ, wake up. It’s snowing!”

His voice is quiet but he can’t keep the excitement out of it. His boyfriend makes a sleepy, indignant nooise and buries his face into Cyrus’ chest. It’s adorable, but it’s not enough to distract him.

“TJ,” he sing-songs quietly. “It’s time to get up.”

“No,” TJ complains, voice muffled by Cyrus’ t-shirt.

It’s only been three weeks since they moved in together, finally able to afford a house and leave their respective apartments and roommates behind (well, sort of… the others came over so much it still felt a little like they were living together). Their new home is the perfect little two-bedroom place on the edge of a quiet town, in a nice neighborhood, with a white picket fence and rose bushes lining the edges of the font yard. The first time they’d viewed it Cyrus had known right away that they had a future here. TJ agreed without hesitation. It’s the kind of place you can make memories and build a family. He hopes one day to put a picture up of their (future) wedding on the mantle piece.

The snow feels like a sign that they’re heading in the right direction.

He gives TJ’s shoulder an imatient poke. “Come on,” he pleads with his best pouting expression. “I’ll make you coffee.”

TJ sighs but lifts his head a little and squints at Cyrus with his sleep-bleary eyes. It’s light enough now that they can see one another, faces illuminated by the the light bouncing off the snow outside, but still dark enough that it probably isn’t necessary to be awake yet.

But… snow. You know?

“Time’s it?” He asks through a yawn.

Cyrus glances at the clock and bites his lip. “Six thirteen.”

It’s a testament to how much he loves Cyrus that TJ doesn’t push him out of the bed then and there. Instead he just groan and lets his head flop down again. “You’re insane.”

“It’s snowing,” Cyrus repeats insistently. “This is the best part of winter. Think about all the cool things we can do if you get up now. We can build snowmen, make snow angels… have a snowball fight. Maybe we can even go ice skating down on the pond?”

“We can do all of those things later at an actual human time when people are meant to be awake.”

“But it’s our first snow day together here…”

Cyrus doesn’t even need to look in TJ’s eyes to know he’s won. He sighs, letting his exasperation out into the pillow, then rolls over and sits up.

“Fine, but you’re getting me that coffee,” he grumbles.

“Yay!” Cyrus crows and leaps out of bed chanting. “Snow day! Snow day! Snow day!”

His chants continue as he heads out the door and TJ exhales, watching with fond eyes as he goes. It’s hard to be mad when someone you love is that excited.

Cyrus does get to put up pictures of their wedding on the mantle. They go nicely alongside his pictures of their first day out in the snow together.

blog.description: Just a teenage girl who has a gay crush on Bex. Also this page is filled with reasons to Love Bex Mack because there are TONS of reasons.

body:
Buffy’s, Cyrus’s, and Andi’s

summary:
There’s some updates to Disney Channel’s Schedule for this week, January 28-February 3. 

Changes include a reruns of Jessie and...
caption: There’s some updates to Disney Channel’s Schedule for this week, January 28-February 3.  Changes include a reruns of Jessie and Gravity Falls airing Late Sunday, 2/3 (Early Monday, 2/4) replacing Mickey Mouse Clubhouse from 5-6 AM at that time.

summary: Ok but I absolutely love the Resist = Vote photo-shoot  Josh and Luke did. I was so proud of my progressive boys. It was already...
question: Ok but I absolutely love the Resist = Vote photo-shoot  Josh and Luke did. I was so proud of my progressive boys. It was already really cool they wanted Luke for the shoot with Josh given all the others (including Josh) are far more recognisable in terms of screen credits,
answer:
I was so hyped the day those pictures came out oh my god. I would be interested in knowing more about how that photo campaign came together. Although they seemed to cover their bases as far as relevant teen TV shows go (Riverdale, 13RW, Andi Mack) it doesn’t seem like they were all too concerned about how recognizable everyone was since there were also much lesser known models included in the campaign. But Luke and Josh were the only two people included in the campaign who were actually too young to vote in the election, so I’m assuming they weren’t really interested in any of the younger cast members to be part of it. I doubt Josh and Luke would have even been included if Andi Mack weren’t so well known for its diversity, and if Josh wasn’t so political. 

Either way. Still thrilled that they did that. It was such a good shoot.
